III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162
Section Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion
Description plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination
(11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth are being locked in their rooms for unknown reasons.
Investigation Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
05/14/2025. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A disclosed that
she is aware youths are being locked in their bedrooms, but did
not provide any details or identify specific youth that are being
secluded.
Consumer Rights Officer was interviewed at the facility on
05/14/2025. Consumer Rights Officers denied youths are being
secluded in their bedrooms as a form of discipline. Consumer
Rights Officer is unaware of any incident reports involving youths
being locked in their bedroom. He reported bedroom doors cannot
be locked from the outside. The only bedrooms that are locked are
the ones that are not in use.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 05/14/2025. Youth A
denied ever being locked in her bedroom. Youth A has been at the
facility for 7 months. Youth A denied being secluded in her
bedroom. Youth A reported she heard that in the past, youths
were being secluded in their bedrooms at night, however she
could not provide any details of when this occurred.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on 05/14/2025.
Supervisor reported the facility does not allow seclusion.
Supervisor is not aware of any youth being locked in their
bedroom currently or in the past.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed at the facility on
05/22/2025. Youth B and Youth C denied being locked in their
bedrooms. Youth B and Youth C further denied witnessing any
youth being locked in their bedroom.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2025.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 denied youths are being secluded in their
bedrooms. Staff 1 and Staff 2 reported they are not aware of any
youth being locked in their bedroom currently or in the past.
2

Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on 05/22/2025 observed wing A and
wing B, the bedroom doors were found to be unsecured. The
youths were in the main common area. No concerns were noted.
Documents Reviewed:
• Facility Behavior Management Policy – Prohibited Physical
Intervention Practices include but are not to: • Seclusion
(secured or by verbal directive) preventing a client’s egress
from the designated area will not be utilized.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with the licensing rule, based
on interviews with staff and youths there is no evidence youths are
being secluded.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
